items.title: The sort of world in which Rudd has lived most of his career is now gone
items.description: One month after Kevin Rudd leaves his post as Australia's ambassador to Washington, Donald Trump will make his first presidential visit to China in almost 10 years.

items.title: Adelaide Writers' Week cancelled after week of escalating controversy
items.description: The remaining members of the Adelaide Festival board will step down and this year's Writers' Week event has been cancelled, after days of furore regarding the decision to cancel a scheduled appearance by Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah.

items.title: Iran using 'military-grade' jamming to take down Musk's Starlink
items.description: Human rights groups estimate more than 500 people have been killed and more than 10,600 arrested in the ongoing protests.

items.title: Retired navy captain Mark Kelly sues the Pentagon over free speech
items.description: The US Democratic senator alleges the president and defense secretary are trying to intimidate him into silence for comments he made in a video calling on serving troops to defy illegal orders.

items.title: Markets shudder as White House goes to war with everyone
items.description: In the past week, the US has dramatically expanded and accelerated its attacks both inside and outside its borders. Here's where Australia stands in the fray.

items.title: Live: Threat of more severe weather in Victoria as 179 homes lost to blazes
items.description: Firefighters continue to battle fires across the state after the grim news that a person had been found dead and at least 400,000 hectares have been burnt. Follow live.

items.title: Three people rescued from central Queensland flood as ex-Cyclone Koji moves west
items.description: A clean-up is under way at Clermont, which remains cut off by floodwaters, as already-saturated western communities are being warned of possible heavy rains.

items.title: Woman behind crepe attack on chief minister sentenced in court
items.description: The woman who assaulted a former Northern Territory chief minister with a cream crepe has been sentenced to 12 months imprisonment, fully suspended.

items.title: Police searching for man with firearm in town south of Perth
items.description: Significant police resources are deployed to Pinjarra, about 80 kilometres from Perth, after a man is reportedly spotted on CCTV with a firearm in a semi-rural area.

items.title: 'I do my best to settle my conscience': SA premier becomes emotional at press conference
items.description: Peter Malinauskas becomes tearful during a media conference where he faces extensive questions about the crisis surrounding Adelaide Writers' Week and allegations of homophobia against Adelaide United made by former player Josh Cavallo.

items.title: ASIC ban for couple linked to disgraced former MP Daryl Maguire
items.description: A husband and wife are banned from managing corporations for five years after the failure of several companies, one of which was linked to the former Wagga Wagga MP.

items.title: As she hangs up her bat and gloves, Healy is set to conquer a new arena
items.description: Alyssa Healy was thrust into headlines when she was just 16 for daring to break into a literal old boys' club, but has expertly handled the national spotlight with bat, ball and microphone in hand.

items.title: Details of sweeping changes to hate speech and gun laws revealed
items.description: Directly quoting from a religious text for the purpose of teaching or discussion may provide a defence under the federal government's hate speech laws proposed in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: Live: ASX rises after Wall Street rally despite Powell probe
items.description: Australian stocks are trading higher after investors on Wall Street mostly brushed aside concerns about the US Justice Department's criminal investigation of Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell. Follow live.

items.title: Minnesota sues federal government to stop immigration crackdown
items.description: Minnesota and its two cities sue the Trump administration in a bid to stop an immigration crackdown that led to the fatal shooting of Renee Good last week.

items.title: New passport changes create headache for Australian British dual citizens
items.description: British Australian retiree Ian Fletcher is meant to be going on a seven-week holiday to the UK with his wife, Vicki, in April, but it may not go ahead due to passport changes.

items.title: Vanessa decluttered and said goodbye to the fantasy version of herself
items.description: I was tired of trying to live up to an idealised version of myself. So, I decided to do something I had learnt from Marie Kondo: sort my wardrobe into what brought me joy and what didn't.

items.title: Koala caught on motion-sensor camera in rare sighting near Canberra
items.description: A motion-sensor camera has captured the rare sight of a koala in the wild at a wildlife sanctuary in Googong near the ACT border.

items.title: 'Widespread alarm and turmoil': NSW boy facing jail over hoax calls to US
items.description: A "young boy" from regional New South Wales is accused of making fake emergency calls claiming mass shootings were taking place at major retail and education institutions in the United States.

items.title: More charged over alleged home invasion police say prompted by road rage
items.description: Two more teenagers are charged following an alleged home invasion shooting, which police believe stemmed from a road rage confrontation.

items.title: CCTV released after second person charged over teen's fatal stabbing
items.description: Police have released CCTV of three men dressed in dark hoodies, who they believe can assist with inquiries.

items.title: Byron bridge fire highlights tourist hotspot's homelessness crisis
items.description: A bridge used daily by thousands of drivers is shut in northern NSW, after a fire beneath it destroys the camps of two homeless men with "nowhere else to go".

items.title: Albanese calls national day of mourning for Bondi victims
items.description: There will be a national day of mourning for the victims of the Bondi terror attack this month, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says.

items.title: Trump's attack on Federal Reserve 'extremely chilling'
items.description: A criminal probe into the US Federal Reserve chair threatens to undermine the US dollar and the global monetary system. Local analysts warn the implications for Australia are profound.

items.title: Why Iran watchers are sceptical of videos from outside a Tehran morgue
items.description: As images of rows and rows of dead bodies at a morgue in Tehran circulate, the regime is accused of making it impossible for families to grieve.
